headers.name: Access-Token
headers.description: Authorized access token. For details, see Authentication .

parameters.name: custom_audience_ids
parameters.description: A list of Audience IDs. Length range is [1, 100] .

parameters.name: history_size
parameters.description: The size of the history data which the user requests.

top_fields.name: code
top_fields.description: Response code. For the complete list of response codes and descriptions, see Appendix - Return Codes .

top_fields.name: message
top_fields.description: Response message. For details, see Appendix - Return Codes .

fields.name: list
fields.description: A list of audience details.

fields.name: audience_details
fields.description: Audience data.

fields.name: audience_id
fields.description: Audience ID.

fields.name: msg
fields.description: Information about audience status.

fields.name: audience_sub_type
fields.description: Audience sub type, indicating the type of ads that the audience can be used. Enum values: NORMAL : Normal audience. It can be used in non-R&F ads. REACH_FREQUENCY : Audience for Reach & Frequency. It can only be used in R&F ads.

fields.name: error_msg
fields.description: Error information when creating or modifying an audience.

fields.name: is_valid
fields.description: Audience availability. An audience becomes available after it has been processed. An audience becomes invalid after it is expired.

fields.name: is_expiring
fields.description: Whether an audience is expiring. When an audience is expiring, it will expire in less than 60 days.

fields.name: expired_time
fields.description: Time when the audience expires, in the format of "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS".

fields.name: rule
fields.description: If this audience is an engagement audience, app activity audience or website traffic audience, this is the creation rule for it.

fields.name: is_auto_refresh
fields.description: If this audience is an engagement audience / app activity audience or website traffic audience, this indicates whether the audience refreshes daily.

fields.name: shared
fields.description: Whether this audience is shared with others. Enum values: True , False .

fields.name: is_creator
fields.description: Whether this advertiser is the owner of the audience. Enum values: true , false . You can use shared and is_creator to check audience ownership and shared status. The rules are as follows: 1. shared = true and is_creator = true : The advertiser is the owner and the audience is shared to others. 2. shared = true and is_creator = false : The advertiser is NOT the owner and the audience is shared by others. 3. shared = false and is_creator = true : The advertiser is the owner and the audience has not been shared to others.

fields.name: owner_id
fields.description: Advertiser ID of the audience creator. If is_creator = true , owner_id will be advertiser_id that you specified in the request. If is_creator = false , owner_id will be the ID of the advertiser that created the audience.

fields.name: create_time
fields.description: Time when the audience was created, in the format of "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS".

fields.name: type
fields.description: Audience type. Enum values: Customer File Audience ( Customer File Audience ). Engagement Audience ( Engagement Audience ). App Activity Audience ( App Activity Audience ). Website Audience ( Website Traffic Audience ). Lookalike Audience ( Lookalike Audience ). Lead Generation ( Lead Generation Audience ) Rule Business Account ( Business Account Audience ) Rule ad shop ( Shop Activity Audience ) Partner (Partner Audience) Challenge (Challenge Audience) Preferred Population (Premium Audience) Note : Currently, Partner Audience, Challenge Audience and Premium Audience cannot be created through the API.

fields.name: cover_num
fields.description: TikTok coverage, or number of matched users on TikTok.

fields.name: calculate_type Conditional
fields.description: Encryption type. For enum values, see Enumeration - Encryption Type .

fields.name: lookalike_spec
fields.description: Lookalike audience-specific information. Returned only when the audience is a lookalike audience.

fields.name: source_audience_id
fields.description: Source (seed) audience ID.

fields.name: include_source
fields.description: Whether to include the source audience in the new lookalike audience.

fields.name: mobile_os
fields.description: Device operating systems. Enum values support ALL for both ANDROID and IOS . See Enumeration-Audience Management-Lookalike System for details.

fields.name: placements
fields.description: The apps where you want to deliver your ads. Enum values: TikTok , TopBuzz & BuzzVideo , Pangle . See Enumeration - Audience Management-Lookalike Placement for details.

fields.name: location_ids
fields.description: IDs of the locations that you want to target. For enum values, see Enumeration-Lookalike Locations .

fields.name: audience_size
fields.description: Size of lookalike audience. Enum values: NARROW , BALANCED and BROAD .

fields.name: audience_history
fields.description: List of audience modification history.

fields.name: action
fields.description: Modification made. To learn about the meaning of the values, see "Mapping between action value and operation via /dmp/custom_audience/update/" section below.

fields.name: action_detail
fields.description: Modification result.

fields.name: editor
fields.description: Operator used. If modification was made through the TikTok API for Business, the value is "open_api".

fields.name: msg
fields.description: If the operation is partial success, the information will be shown here.

fields.name: opt_time
fields.description: The operation time. Formats such asï¼š2019-04-14 06:52:56.

fields.name: request_id
fields.description: The log id of a request, which uniquely identifies the request.
